value.title: UNESCO member states adopt first global agreement on ethics of AI

value.title: UN agency pushes global AI ethics norm that bans use of the technology for social scoring, mass surveillance purposes
value.excerpt: The UN agency’s recommendations come more than a month after China introduced its own set of ethical guidelines governing artificial intelligence.

value.title: Can AI Truly Give Us a Glimpse of Lost Masterpieces?
value.excerpt: Recent projects used machine learning to resurrect paintings by Klimt and Rembrandt. They raise questions about what computers can understand about art.

value.title: Defining what's ethical in artificial intelligence needs input from Africans
value.excerpt: Artificial intelligence (AI) was once the stuff of science fiction. But it's becoming widespread. It is used in mobile phone technology and motor vehicles. It powers tools for agriculture and healthcare.

value.title: AI Education for Teens: Lifting the Hood on Data and Machine Learning
value.excerpt: What are key ideas and intuitions foundational to AI that AI education in secondary schools should target? value.title: University of Helsinki: Massive open online course Ethics of AI translated in Finnish and Swedish
value.excerpt: The Finnish and Swedish translations for the University of Helsinki’s online course Ethics of AI will open on 23 November, in connection with a seminar on information policy at the Ministry of Finances.

value.title: NYC bill to rein in AI hiring tools looks like it was meant to backfire
value.excerpt: New York's passed a bill to purportedly curb the use of biased AI software for hiring, but one glance at the document shows it's feckless.

value.title: Want ethical AI? Hand the keys to middle schoolers.
value.excerpt: An innovative curriculum developed at MIT takes aim at eliminating the biases inherent in our algorithms—by teaching the concept to youngsters.

value.title: AI Weekly: Defense Department proposes new guidelines for developing AI technologies
value.excerpt: The U.S. Defense Department's Defense Innovation Unit has proposed new ethics guidelines for private contractors developing AI systems.

value.title: Steps Every Leader Should Take to Prepare for Artificial Intelligence

value.excerpt: Commentary: AI is considered "world changing" by policymakers, but it's unclear how to ensure positive outcomes.

value.title: SIU 2021: Ethical and Legal Considerations of Using Artificial Intelligence in Healthcare
value.excerpt: In a Hot Topic session during the Société Internationale D’Urologie (SIU) 2021 annual meeting focused on the role of artificial intelligence (AI) in urology, Dr. Quoc-Dien Trinh discussed bias in AI and important ethical and legal considerations in the use of AI in health care.

value.title: Thoughts On Artificial Intelligence Conferences For Business Audiences
value.excerpt: If you are a business line manager or in the CxO suite, you want to hear what is actually being accomplished with artificial intelligence, with strong examples that are relatable. You also want to hear about the non-technical implications of the technology.

value.title: Strange News: Virgin Condor Births, Ethical AI, Facebook and Facial Recognition

value.title: Report: 95% of execs say hiring professionals trained in AI is difficult
value.excerpt: As leaders consider hiring new AI talent, they shouldn't overlook the importance of training to help mitigate bias and encourage ethical AI.

value.title: Is Scotland A Major Contender In The AI Space?
value.excerpt: Governments and countries are taking advantage of the tremendous transformation presented by AI to position themselves for global competitiveness. Scotland is one such country doing this. Are they now becoming a major contender in the AI space?

value.title: Facebook, bad news and business ethics: Consider the consequences of every decision
value.excerpt: Facebook's recent challenges should serve as a lesson to all leaders to identify and mitigate ethical concerns before they escalate.

value.title: The ethics of digital technology in the food sector
value.excerpt: Imagine a world in which smart packaging for supermarket-ready meals updates you in real-time to tell you about carbon footprints, gives live warnings on product recalls and instant safety alerts because allergens were detected unexpectedly in the factory.

value.title: Unis are using AI to keep students from cheating and it’s a bit creepy
value.excerpt: Some programs simply enable a person to supervise students remotely. More sophisticated, automated proctoring software hijacks the student’s computer to block and monitor suspicious activity. These programs often use artificial intelligence (AI) to scrutinise exam conduct.

value.title: Honesty and ethics not well explained by managers in New Zealand
value.excerpt: The majority of employees in New Zealand are confident their organizations are honest and there is no misconduct at work, but their line managers don't always explain the importance of honesty and ethics in the work they are leading.
